reviews.review: Have a love/hate relationship with this game. It's a great game to play with friends.
good game very funny
COCO MOMO

With nearly 300 hours on this game, here's what I can say. The best way to play this game, as either side, is to stay at low rank (Anything below Bronze). Everyone around that area is mostly balanced for skill level. Some games, you'll steamroll, and others you'll get stomped. If you win, be humble about it. Once you get to Bronze, everyone is fully adapted to the meta, not giving you any room to have fun. If you play Killer, prepare to be bullied by Survivors who are trying to have fun at your expense. As a Killer, you will be screwed over by about 1/3 of all maps in the game, and the Survivors will exploit fair game mechanics to anger you. Everytime they constantly slip through your fingers, even by a little, they will rub it in. Survivors want you to feel bad about yourself, like you're a real POS who's terrible at this game, and it will work. You'll get pissed off, you'll play sloppy, and you'll look for the strongest killers and the best perks in the hope that you can smash them into the ground for their bullying. And if Survivors open up the Exit Gates, they will wait for you to get close, teabag at you, click their little flashlights, point, or just stand right at the exit so you can pointlessly hit them. Survivors are the best example of what makes a toxic playerbase.

As a Survivor, you will run into Killers who have suffered at the hands of these toxic survivors, and they'll take it out on you. Due to DbD not having any sort of targeted matchmaking, they can't simply take on the same survivors again for revenge. They need a win, because they've been abused and bullied by Survivors. You'll get stuck with clueless, selfish, and potentially troll teammates that will purposefully get you killed, and it'll piss you off. It won't seem fair that you got singled out, or that your teammate body blocked you so the Killer could hit you, or that they hide in a bush all game while you try and do all the objectives, then escape while you distract the Killer and die.

In Dead by Daylight, you're either the bully, or you're the one being bullied. It's a game of mental abuse, of high blood pressure, and it's by design. So, if you're a level-headed individual who isn't easily affected by obvious troll tactics and mockery, please come and play DbD; the community needs more people like you. If you're humble and don't need to rub in every victory you have over others, come play DbD. If you're a good sport, come play DbD.

If your idea of fun is playing a game of tag with someone, then turning around to flip them off everytime they lunge for you and miss, we don't want you. You're a bully, and everyone would be better off without your company.

Игра интересная, задумка огонь, раньше было плохо всё из-за багов и прочего дерьма, но сейчас всё хорошо,
Единственное что стоит поменять это ранговую систему, слишком плохо она работает. Почему если выживший  ливают то маньяк должен поддаваться чтобы затягивать игру ради капель? Или почему если выживший бегает всю игру то он может потерять ранг из-за того что он только бегал, получение прогресса зависит лишь от  удачи и продолжительности игры. Было бы круто если систему эту переработали, чтобы было и не легко получать этот ранг, и возможно

Este juego es hermoso, pase tanto momentos buenos como momentos malos. Lo compre porque un amigo me lo recomendó para jugarlo juntos, esto desencadeno en 600 horas jugadas con risas y sustos. Pero como dije, nada es de color rosa, ya llegando a lo ultimo este juego se vuelve repetitivo y molesto. Considero que hay muchas cosas para mejorar en la jugabilidad y en otras cosas, pero, no puedo NO recomendar este juego, vale cada peso que inviertas.

i absolutely love this game, the only real issue is matchmaking time and consistency. I find myself waiting several minutes for queues at times, and other times it's nearly instant. You'll sometimes match with players that are 5-6 ranks above or below you which can make for inconsistent game play at times, but the game is extremely fun regardless.

It's a great game but the UI is now terrible. The player models weren't as good as the were but it's a fun game (with a 5 stack). The game can be really fun at some times, if you are good at juking people in games then you will enjoy this game as survivor. If you are good at predicting what people will do next and you don't give up trying to chase and kill someone then you will enjoy this game as killer.
really fun game

I wish steam had a middle option for reviews.

Dead By Daylight is a very good game, as long as you don't play killer.

You have two options to win as killer:

Option 1: Grind for hours and hours as only killer, while facing toxic players. (as you can see by my playtime, I really don't want to do that)
Option 2: Pay money for the dlc killers, who are usually supreme to the base game killers in all ways. (stupid modern game dev logic, akin to ea)

You have one option to win as survivor:

Option 1: Play survivor (you can outrun most killers or at least annoy them by just running in opposing circles and pallet looping or placing obstacles and fleeing)

This game really needs some balance.

this game makes me want to bash my head against my desk until i can no longer think

and yet ive still played for 23 hours

Wirklich grandioses Spieldesignt mit ner guten Lernkurve wenn man vorhat sich zu verbessern. man braucht nen moment bis man drin ist und essentielle dinge zu lernen.
Angefangen bei Skillchecks über das Loopen von killern und dem ausweichen vor dem killer ohne dass er einen jagd.
Der Größte nachteil sind wirklich oft die leute mit denen man gematched wird, welche sich einfach die ganze runde in schränken verstecken oder es einfach ignorieren wenn ein anderer survivor an nem haken hängt.

Die beste erfahrung für anfänger liegt meiner meinung nach darin mit freunden als Survivor erstmal das spiel kennen zu lernen.
